result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

08:34 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Attorney Preston Smead contacted Court requesting hearing be rescheduled as he is not able to attend in-person; Defendant provided notice in hand.
Initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
